abstract: Berkshire Hathaway said “the credit crisis has abated,” bolstering the firm’s earnings potential after Chief Executive Warren Buffett agreed to pay $26 billion and take on debt to fund his biggest takeover.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway said “the credit crisis has abated,” bolstering the firm’s earnings potential after Chief Executive Warren Buffett agreed to pay $26 billion and take on debt to fund his biggest takeover.
lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway said “the credit crisis has abated,” bolstering the firm’s earnings potential after its chief executive, Warren E. Buffett, agreed to pay $26 billion and take on debt to finance Berkshire’s biggest takeover, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Berkshire Says Credit Crisis Has Abated
